title: What is it?
text: Crystal Nodes (CN) is an addon for the 3D modelling & animation program Blender that enables easy creation of crystals illustrations. CN is focused on providing tools for providing Crystallography illustrations and it is not (for now) a computational tool for calculating inorganic structures

title: What is it?
text:
Features:

generic tools for creating basic grain forms:

extended primitives:

Octahedron
Tetrahedron
Dodecahendron
Rombic Dodecahedron
Tetrakis Hexahedron

non isometric crystal system forms:

tetragonal trapezohedron
trigonal - tetragonal - hexagonal - dihexagonal
ditrigonal
rhombic tetragonal
non iso ditetragonal


tools for instancing grains according to the most common growth patterns:

Felted
Foliated
Granular
Parallel
Plumose
Radiating

tools for:

creating h k l planes
extruding and faces mirroring
translate according to bravais lattices

title: Installation
text:
Download the latest bundled release from the releases page. Don’t download the GitHub repo itself, as this won’t install inside of Blender.






Safari



When downloading on MacOS with Safari, it automatically unzips the file into a MolecularNodes folder. This is extremely unhelpful as Blender requires the .zip file to install the addon. Either download with a different browser, or compress the folder again to MolecularNodes.zip.

title: Installation
text:
Installing the Addon






Windows Administrator



If you are on Windows, you may need to run Blender as Administrator to successfully complete the following installation. If you are using Blender Launcher , just launch you favorite version of Blender and that’s it



Open Preferences Panel


Click “Edit” and “. ’Preferences” or press Cmd +  , on Mac.
Click “Add-ons”
Click “Install”
Select the downloaded file Crystal Nodes_X.zip

After installing remember to enable the node

title: Primitives
text:
Inputs
Name The name of the attribute to read.


Properties


Outputs
Attribute The attribute data stored on the geometry.
Exists True if the attribute accessed by the node is present in the connected context.

title: Tools
text:
the following tools are present

Extrude
h k l
Elongation/Thickness
Mirror
Bravais

title: Crystallographics forms
text: The Crystallographic menu is subdivided in Isometric and Non Isometric forms

title: Crystallographics forms
text:
Isometric:
Select the Iso crystal form you would like to create. If you select more then one form you can apply the modifier and then separate the forms created by material (each form will be created with a different default material)



Separate by Materials

title: Crystallographics forms
text:
Non Isometric



Non Isometric Crystal Forms nodes


The following Non Isometric Crystal forms can be created via the following nodes

tetragonal trapezohedron
trigonal - tetragonal - hexagonal - dihexagonal
ditrigonal
rhombic tetragonal
non iso ditetragonal

All the nodes (except the tetragonal trapezohedron) have options for building the Prism, Pyramid or Dypiramid non Isometric forms.



Nodes ouput

title: h k l node
text: Create h k l faces and planes

title: Growth Pattern
text:
These nodes takes care of helping you in creating the habits of your crystalline masses. The following patterns are included

Felted
Foliated
Granular
Parallel
Plumose
Radiating

All nodes have in common the possibility to Translate, Rotate and Scale the pattern and also to randomize scale of the grains. An option for rotating the grains is also present where needed. Its due to remind the user that elongate minerals can form parallel, radiating and felted masses. Micaceous and platy minerals grows in foliated and plumose forms while equant minerals can form granular masses.

title: Growth Pattern
text:
Examples



Pattern nodes example


A realize instance and mesh bolean nodes were added in order to have cleaner topology. Please notice that the boolean node can highly impact the computation of the node group.
